Question: When an article is sold at its marked price, it gives a profit of 25% If a discount of 9.6% is allowed on the marked price, then the profit percent will be:
Solution:
Given:
Profit = 25%
Discount = 9.6%
Formulae Used:
Selling price = Marked price - discount on marked price
Selling price = cost price + profit on cost price
Calculations:
Let the CP of the article be x.
MP of the article = x × (125/100) = 1.25x
SP of the article = 1.25 × (100/90.4) = 1.13x
Profit = 1.13x – x = 0.13x
Profit percentage = (0.13x/x) × 100 = 13%
Short Trick:
Suppose the CP = 4 unit
MP = 5
∴ SP = 5 × (90.4/100) = 4.52 unit
Profit percentage = [(4.52 – 4)/4] × 100 = 13%

Question: The bisector of ∠B in ΔABC meets AC at D. If AB = 10 cm, BC = 11 cm and AC = 14 cm, then the length of AD is∶
Solution:
Given, AB = 10 cm, BC = 11 cm and AC = 14 cm
In ΔABC, BD bisector of ∠B, then
AB/BC = AD/DC
⇒ 10/11 = AD/DC
⇒ AD ∶ DC = 10x ∶ 11x
⇒ AC = AD + DC = 14 cm
⇒ 10x + 11x = 14
⇒ 21x = 14
⇒ x = 14/21
⇒ x = 2/3
⇒ AD = 10 × (2/3)
⇒ AD = 20/3 cm

Question: If the curved surface area of a solid cylinder is one-third of its total surface area, then what is the ratio of its diameter to its height?
Solution:
As we know,
Curved surface area of cylinder = 2 πrh
Total surface area of cylinder = 2 πr(h + r)
According to the question
[2 πrh/2 πr (r + h)] = 1/3
⇒ 3h = h + r
⇒ 3h – h = r
⇒ 2h = r
⇒ h/r = 1/2
⇒ h/2r = 1/4
⇒ 4/1 = 2r/h
So, ratio of diameter to height of cylinder = 4 : 1

Question: The ratio of the incomes of A and B last year was 4 ∶ 3, respectively. The ratios of their individual incomes of the last year and the present year are 3 ∶ 4 and 5 ∶ 6, respectively. If their total income for the present year is Rs. 8.04 lakh, then the income of B last year was∶
Solution:
The ratio of the incomes of A and B last year was = 4x ∶ 3x ----(1)
The ratio of income of A the last year to the present year is = 3x ∶ 4x ----(2)
The ratio of income of B the last year to the present year is = 5x ∶ 6x ----(3)
To equate last year income of A and B in the above equation we will multiply 15 in equation (1) and 20 in equation (2) and 9 in equation (3)
The ratio of the incomes of A and B last year was = 60x ∶ 45x ----(4)
The ratio of income of A the last year to the present year is = 60x ∶ 80x ----(5)
The ratio of income of B the last year to the present year is = 45x ∶ 54x ----(6)
From equation (5) and equation (6)
The ratio of present income of A to the income of B = 80x ∶ 54x
According to the question
⇒ 80x + 54x = 8.04 lakh
⇒ 134x = 8.04 lakh
⇒ x = 8.04/134
⇒ x = 0.06
Last year income of B was = 45x = 45 × 0.06 = 2.7 lakh

Question: The speed of a boat in still water is 18 km/h and the speed of the current is 6 km/h. In how much time (in hours) will the boat travel a distance of 90 km upstream and the same distance downstream?
Solution:
Speed of boat = 18 km/h
Speed of current = 6 km/h
Speed of boat in downstream = 18 + 6 = 24 km/hr
Speed of boat in upstream = 18 – 6 = 12 km/hr
According to the question
∴ Total time to cover 90 km distance in upstream and 90 km distance in downstream = 90/24 + 90/12 = (90 + 180)/24 = 270/24 = \(11\frac{1}{4}\) hr

Question: A person sells an article at 16% below its cost price. Had he sold it for Rs. 33 more, he would have gained 14%. To gain 25%, he should sell the article for∶
Solution:
Let the CP of the article be Rs. x
If article sold at 16% below its cost price, then SP of the article = x × (84/100) = 0.84x
If article sold at 14% above its cost price, then SP of the article = x × (114/100) = 1.14x
According to the question
⇒ 1.14x – 0.84x = 33
⇒ 0.3x = 33
⇒ x = 33/0.3
⇒ x = 110
To gain 25% on CP, then SP of the article = 110 × (125/100) = 137.5
Short Trick∶
Let CP of the article be 100%, it should be sold at 125% to gain 25%
⇒ 16% + 14% = 33
⇒ 30% = 33
⇒ 125% = (33/30) × 125 = 137.5
Alternate solution:
Let CP = 100x
According to question,
⇒ 1.14x – 0.84x = 33
⇒ 0.3x = 33
⇒ x = 33/0.3
⇒ x = 1.1
∴ CP = 100x = 100 × 1.1 = 110
Now,
125/100 × 110 = 137.5 Rs.

Question: The average weight of a certain number of students in a group is 72 kg. If 10 students having an average weight of 78kg leave and 4 students having an average weight of 80 kg join the group, the average weight of the students in the group decreases by 0.7 kg. The number of students initially in the group is:
Solution:
Given:
The average weight of a certain number of students in a group is 72 kg.
10 students having an average weight of 78kg. leave.
4 students having an average weight of 80 kg join the group.
The average weight of the students in the group decreases by 0.7 kg.
Formula:
Average weight = Total weight/Total number of people
Calculation:
Let the total number of students be x.
Average weight of total students = 72 kg
Sum of weight of 10 students whose average weight of 78 kg = 10 × 78 = 780 kg
Sum of weight of 4 students whose average weight of 80 kg = 4 × 80 = 320
According to the question
72x – 780 + 320 = (x – 10 + 4) (72 – 0.7)
⇒ 72x – 460 = (x – 6) × 71.3
⇒ 72x – 460 = 71.3x – 427.8
⇒ 72x – 71.3x = 460 – 427.8
⇒ 0.7x = 32.2
⇒ x = 32.2/0.7 = 46
∴ Number of students initially was 46.

Average weight of some students be = 72 kg
Deviation of weight of 10 students who leave the class = (78 – 72) × 10 = 60 kg
Deviation of weigh of 4 students who join the class = (80 – 72) × 4 = 32 kg
Let the number of students after be x then,
⇒ 0.7 × x = 60 – 32
⇒ x = 28/0.7 = 40
∴ Number of students was initially = 40 + 10 – 4 = 46

Question: In a class, \(83\frac{1}{3}\%\) of the number of students are girls and the rest are boys. If 60% of the number of boys and 80% of the number of girls are present, then what percentage of the total number of students in the class is absent?
Solution:
Let total number of students in class be x
Number of girls = x × (5/6) = 5x/6
Number of boys = x × (1/6) = x/6
Number of absent girls = (5x/6) × (20/100) = x/6
Number of absent boys = (x/6) × (40/100) = x/15
Total number of students who absent = (x/6) + (x/15) = (5x + 2x)/30 = 7x/30
Percentage of students who absent = [(7x/30)/x] × 100 = 70/3% = \(23\frac{1}{3}\)
Short Trick∶
\(83\frac{1}{3}\%\) = 5/6
Let total number of students be 60
Number of girls = 60 × (5/6) = 50
Number of boys = 60 – 50 = 10
Number of absent Boys = 10 × (40/100) = 4
Number of absent girls = 50 × (20/100) = 10
Percentage of absent students = [(4 + 10)/60] × 100 = \(23\frac{1}{3}\)

Question: A sum lent out at simple interest amounts to Rs. 6076 in 1 year and Rs. 7504 in 3 years. The sum and the rate of interest (approx) p.a are respectively:
Solution:
Given that,
Sum lent out at simple interest to 6076 in 1 year and 7504 in 3 years.
SI of 2 years = 7504 – 6076 = 1428
SI of 1 year = 1428/2 = 714
Principal = 6076 – 714 = 5362
SI = (P × R × T)/100
SI = (5362 × r × 1)/100
⇒ 714 = (5362 × r × 1)/100
⇒ r = 71400/5362 ≈ 13.32%

Question: A sum of Rs. x is divided among A, B and C such that the ratio of the shares of A and B is 6 ∶ 7 and that of B and C is 3 ∶ 2. If the difference between the shares of A and C is Rs. 540, then the value of x is∶
Solution:
The ratio of shares of A to B = 6 ∶ 7 ----(1)
The ratio of shares of B to C = 3 ∶ 2 ----(2)
Multiply by 3 in equation (1) and multiply by 7 in equation (2)
The ratio of shares of A, B and C = 18 ∶ 21 ∶ 14
Let ratio of shares of A, B and C = 18k ∶ 21k ∶ 14k
According to the question
18k – 14k = 540
⇒ 4k = 540
⇒ k = 540/4 = 135
Sum of shares of A, B and C = 18k + 21k + 14k = 53k = 53 × 135 = 7155

Question: A, B and C invested their capitals in the ratio of 2 : 3 : 5 The ratio of months for which A, B and C invested is 4 : 2 : 3. If C gets a share of profit which Is Rs. 1,47,000 more than that of A, then B’s share of profit is:
Solution:
Ratio of capitals invested by A, B and C = 2 : 3 : 5
Ratio of time A, B and C = 4 : 2 : 3
As we know,
Profit = Time × Money
Ratio of profit A, B and C = (2 × 4) : (3 × 2) : (5 : 3) = 8 : 6 : 15
Let the ratio of profit A, B and C = 8k : 6k : 15K
According to the question
15k – 8k = 147000
⇒ 7k = 147000
⇒ k = 147000/7 = 21000
∴ Profit share of B = 6k = 6 × 21000 = 126000
Short trick:

(15 – 8 = 7 unit) = 147000
⇒ 1 unit = 14700/7 = 21000
⇒ 6 unit = 21000 × 6 = 126000
∴ Profit share of B = 126000

Question: The value of 9 × 6 ÷ 24 + 8 ÷ 2 of 5 – 30 ÷ 4 of 4 + 27 × 5 ÷ 9 is∶
Solution:
Follow BODMAS rule to solve this question, as per the order given below∶

Step-1∶ Parts of an equation enclosed in 'Brackets' must be solved first, and in the bracket,

Step-2∶ Any mathematical 'Of' or 'Exponent' must be solved next,

Step-3∶ Next, the parts of the equation that contain 'Division' and 'Multiplication' are calculated,

Step-4∶ Last but not least, the parts of the equation that contain 'Addition' and 'Subtraction' should be calculated.

9 × 6 ÷ 24 + 8 ÷ 2 of 5 – 30 ÷ 4 of 4 + 27 × 5 ÷ 9

⇒ 9 × (6/24) + 8 ÷ 10 – 30 ÷ 16 + 27 × (5/9)

⇒ (9/4) + (8/10) – (30/16) + 3 × 5

⇒ (9/4) + (4/5) – (15/8) + 15

⇒ (90 + 32 – 75 + 600)/40
⇒ 647/40

Question: A circle is inscribed in quadrilateral ABCD touching AB, BC, CD and AD at the points P, Q, R and S, respectively, and ∠B = 90°. If AD = 24 cm, AB = 27 cm and DR = 6 cm, then what is the circumference of the circle?
Solution:
Given, AD = 24, AB = 27 and DR = 6
In quadrilateral PBQO
∠P = ∠Q = 90° [tangents]
⇒ ∠B = 90° [Given]
⇒ ∠P + ∠B + ∠Q + ∠O = 360°
⇒ 90° + 90° + 90° + ∠O = 360°
⇒ ∠O = 360° –270° = 90°
Now, we can say PBQO is a square, so
PB = BQ = OQ = OP = 90°
AD = AS + SD
AD = AS + DR [DR = SD (tangents)]
⇒ 24 = AS + 6
⇒ AS = 24 – 6 = 18 cm
AB = PB + AP
AB = PB + AS [tangents]
⇒ 27 = PB + 18
⇒ PB = 27 – 18 = 9 cm
So, radius of circum-circle r = 9 cm
∴ Circumference of the circle = 2 πr = 2 × 9 × π = 18π

Question: ΔABC and ΔDBC are on the same base BC but on opposite sides of it. AD and BC intersect each other perpendicularly at O. If AO = a cm, DO = b cm and the area of ΔABC = x cm<sup>2</sup>, then what is the area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) of ΔDBC?
Solution:
Given, AO = a, OD = b and ΔABC = x cm2
As we know,
Area ratio of two triangle on same base = Ratio of corresponding sides (heights)
ar ΔABC/ar ΔBDC = OA/OD
x/ar ΔBDC = a/b
ar ΔBDC = bx/a

Question: Three fractions, x, y, and z, are such that x > y > z. When the smallest of them is divided by the greatest, the result is 9/16, which exceeds y by 0.0625. If \(x + y + z = 1\frac{{13}}{{24}},\) then the value of x + z is:
If \(x = \frac{{\sqrt 5 - \sqrt 3 }}{{\sqrt 5 + \sqrt 3 }}\) and y is the reciprocal of x, then what is the value of (x<sup>3</sup> + y<sup>3</sup>)?
If 8x<sup>3</sup> – 27y<sup>3</sup> = (Ax + By) (Cx<sup>2</sup> – Dy<sup>2</sup>+ 6xy), then what is the value of (A + B + C – D)?
Solution:
Given:
8x3 – 27y3 = (Ax + By) (Cx2 – Dy2+ 6xy)
Formula Used:
(a3 – b3) = (a – b) (a2 + b2 + ab)
Calculation:
8x3 – 27y3 = (Ax + By) (Cx2 – Dy2+ 6xy)
⇒ (2x)3 – (3y)3 = (Ax + By) (Cx2 – Dy2+ 6xy)
⇒ (2x – 3y) (4x2 + 9y2 + 6xy) = (Ax + By) (Cx2 – Dy2+ 6xy)
On comparing
A = 2, B = (-3), C = 4 and D = (-9)
(A + B + C – D) = (2 – 3 + 4 + 9)
⇒ 12
∴ The value of (A + B + C – D) is 12.

Question: What is the ratio of the third proportional to 0.4 and 0.8, to the mean proportional between 13.5 and 0.24?
Solution:
Let A is the third proportional to 0.4 and 0.8, then
0.4 ∶ 0.8 ∷ 0.8 ∶ A
⇒ 0.4/0.8 = 0.8/A
⇒ A = (0.8 × 0.8)/0.4
⇒ A = 1.6
Let B is the mean proportional between 13.5 and 0.24, then
⇒ 13.5 ∶ A ∷ A ∶ 0.24
⇒ 13.5/A = A/0.24
⇒ A2 = 13.5 × 0.24
⇒ A = √3.24
⇒ A = 1.8
Required ratio A ∶ B = 1.6 ∶ 1.8 = 8 ∶ 9

Question: A, B and C start a business. A invests \(33\frac{1}{3}\%\) of the total capital, B invests 25% of the remaining and C invests the rest. If the total profit at the end of a year is Rs. 1,62,000 then A’s share in profit is:
Solution:
Let the total money be 6x
Money invested by A = 6x × (1/3) = 2x
Money invested by B = (6x – 2x) × (1/4) = x
Money invested by C = 6x – 2x – x = 3x
Money ratio invested by A, B and C = 2x : x : 3x
Profit ratio of A, B and C = 2x : x : 3x
Total profit = 162000
2x + x + 3x = 162000
⇒ 6x = 162000
⇒ x = 162000/6 = 27000
∴ Profit share of A = 2x = 2 × 27000 = 54000

Question: The point of intersection of the graphs of the equation 3x – 5y = 19 and 3y – 7x + 1 = 0 is P(α, β). What is the value of (3α – β)?
Solution:
Given:
The point of intersection of the graphs of the equation 3x – 5y = 19 and
3y – 7x + 1 = 0 is P(α, β)
Calculation:
3x - 5y = 19 ----(1)
3y - 7x + 1 = 0
7x - 3y = 1 ----(2)
Subtract equation (1) from equation (2) after multiply by 3 in equation (1) and multiply by 5 in equation (2)
⇒ x = (- 2)
Put x = (- 2) in equation (1)
⇒ 3 × (- 2) - 5y = 19
⇒ - 6 - 5y = 19
⇒ - 5y = 19 + 6 = 25
⇒ y = - 25/5 = (- 5)
α = (- 2) and β = (- 5)
Now, (3α - β)
3 × (- 2) - (- 5)
⇒ (- 6) + 5
⇒ (- 1)
Therefore the correct answer is - 1.

Question: If x<sup>4</sup> – 83x<sup>2</sup> + 1 = 0, then a value of x<sup>3</sup> – x<sup>-3</sup> can be:
Solution:
x4 – 83x2 + 1 = 0
Divided by x2
⇒ x2 – 83 + 1/x2 = 0
⇒ x2 + 1/x2 = 83
As we know,
⇒ (x – 1/x)2 = x2 + 1/x2 – 2
⇒ (x – 1/x)2 = 83 – 2 = 81
⇒ (x – 1/x) = √81 = 9
Again, As we know,
(x – 1/x)3 = x3 – 1/x3 – 3(x – 1/x)
⇒ 93 = (x3 – 1/x3) – 3 × 9
⇒ (x3 – 1/x3) = 729 + 27 = 756
Short Trick:
As we know,
x2 + 1/x2 = a, then
(x – 1/x) = √(a – 2) &
If (x – 1/x) = a, then
(x3 – 1/x3) = a3 + 3a
Now,
x2 + 1/x2 = 83, then
(x – 1/x) = √(83 – 2) = √81 = 9
If (x – 1/x) = 9, then
∴ (x3 – 1/x3) = 93 + 3 × 9 = 729 + 27 = 756

Question: If the 11-digit number 5678x43267y is divisible by 72, then the value of √(5x + 8y) is
Solution:
11-digit number 5678x43267y is divisible by 72, so number divisible by 9 and 8 also
Divisibility law of 8 ⇒ A number divisible by 8 if its last three-digit is divisible by 8.
Divisibility law of 9 ⇒ A number is divisible by 9 if sum of its digit is divisible by 9.
11-digit number 5678x43267y is divisible by 8 if last three-digit 67y divisible by 8, last three-digit 67y divisible by 8 if y = 2
11-digit number 5678x432672 is divisible by 9, if sum of its digit divisible by 9
5 + 6 + 7 + 8 + x + 4 + 3 + 2 + 6 + 7 + 2
⇒ 50 + x
If we put x = 4 then number become 54 which is divisible by 9 so put x = 4.
⇒ 50 + 4 = 54
Now, √(5x + 8y)
√(5 × 4 + 8 × 2)
⇒ √(20 + 16)
⇒ √36
⇒ 6

Question: A hemispherical bowl of internal diameter 36 cm is full of a liquid. This liquid is to be filled into cylindrical bottles each of radius 3 cm and height 12 cm. How many such bottles are required to empty the bowl?
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of hemisphere = (2/3) × πr3
Volume of cylinder = πR2h
Radius of hemispherical bowl (r) = 36/2 = 18 cm
Radius of cylinder (R) = 3 cm
Height of the cylinder (h) = 12 cm
Let the number of bottles required be n then
πR2h × n = (2/3) × πr3
3 × 3 × 12 × n = (2/3) × 18 × 18 × 18
⇒ n = (2 × 18 × 18 × 18)/(3 × 3 × 3 × 12)
⇒ n = 36
So, the number of bottles required is 36.

Question: In a circle with centre O, AC and BD are two chords. AC and BD meet at E when produced. If AB is the diameter and ∠AEB = 68°, then the measure of ∠DOC is:
Solution:
Given:
∠AEB = 68°
Concept:
The angle made in a semi circle is 90°.
The exterior angle of any triangle is equal to the sum of opposite angles of the triangle.
Calculation:

As AB is the diameter of the circle
⇒ ∠ACB = 90°
Now, ∠ABC is the exterior angle of ΔBCE
⇒ ∠ACB = ∠BEC + ∠CBE
⇒ 90° = 68° + ∠CBE
⇒ ∠CBE = 22°
Now, We know that
The angle made by an arc at the center is double of the angle made by the same arc at another point on the circumference in the major segment.
So, ∠COD = 2 × ∠CBE
⇒ ∠COD = 2 × 22° = 44°
∴ The measurement of ∠COD is 44°.

Question: Let x be the least number which when divided by 15, 18, 20 and 27, the remainder in each case is 10 and x is a multiple of 31. What least number should be added to x to make it a perfect square?
Solution:
LCM of 15, 18, 20 and 27 is 540
Number should be divisible by 31, let if we multiply k by in 540 and add 10 then number become divisible by 31
(540k + 10)/31
(31 × 17k) + (13k + 10) /31
Put k = 1, 2, 3, 4, … if we put k = 4, then number divisible by 31
⇒ (13 × 4 + 10) /31
⇒ 62/31
⇒ 2
So, x = 540k + 10 = 540 × 4 + 10 = 2160 + 10 = 2170
∴ If we add 39 in 2170, then number become 2209 which is square of 47.

Question: To do a certain work, the ratio of the efficiencies of X and Y is 5 ∶ 4 Working together, they can complete the same work in 10 days. Y alone starts work and leaves after 5 days. The remaining work completed by X alone in
Solution:
Given:
Efficiencies ratio X to Y = 5 ∶ 4
Formula used:
Total work = Total Efficiency × Total Time
Calculation
Total work = (5 + 4) × 10 = 90 unit
Work done by Y in 5 days = 4 × 5 = 20 unit
Remaining work when Y leaves = 90 – 20 = 70 unit
∴ Time taken to complete remaining work by X = Remaining work/Efficiency of X = 70/5 = 14 days

Question: If x = (164)<sup>169</sup> + (333)<sup>337</sup> – (727)<sup>726</sup>, then what is the units digit of x?
Solution:
Unit digit of (164)169 + (333)337 – (727)726
To check unit place divide power by 4
4169 + 3337 – 7726
⇒ 69/4 = Reminder 1
⇒ 37/4 = Reminder 1
⇒ 26/4 = Reminder 2
⇒ 41 + 31 – 72
⇒ 4 + 3 – 9
⇒ 7 – 9
or, 17 – 9
⇒ 8
So, the unit digit of number x is 8.

Question: Pipes A and B can fill a tank in 16 hours and 24 hours, respectively, and pipe C alone can empty the full tank in x hours. All the pipes were opened together at 10:30 AM, but C was closed at 2:30 PM. If the tank was full at 8:30 PM on the same day, then what is the value of x?
Solution:
Pipes A and B can fill a tank in 16 hrs and 24 hrs respectively, and pipe C alone can empty the full tank in x hrs.
Pipe A and pipe B work for = 10 : 30 AM to 8 : 30 PM = 10 hrs
Pipe C work for = 10 : 30 to 2 : 30 PM = 4 hrs
According to the question
(10) × (1/16 + 1/24) – (4/x) = 1
⇒ (10) × [(3 + 2)/48] – (4/x) = 1
⇒ (10) × (5/48) – (4/x) = 1
⇒ (25/24) – (4/x) = 1
⇒ 4/x = (25/24) – 1
⇒ 4/x = 1/24
⇒ x = 24 × 4 = 96 hr
Short trick:

Total work = 48
Efficiency ratio of A to B = 3 : 2
Let the efficiency of pipe C be k, then
Pipe A and pipe B work for = 10:30 AM to 8:30 PM = 10 hrs
Pipe C work for = 10:30 to 2:30 PM = 4 hrs
According to the question
10(3 + 2) – 4k = 48
⇒ 10 × 5 – 4k = 48
⇒ 4k = 50 – 48
⇒ k = 1/2
So, pipe C alone can empty the full tank in = 48/(1/2) = 96 hr
So, x = 96 hrs

Question: If the price of petrol increases by 19% and Sunitha intends to spend only an additional 12% on petrol, by what percent should she reduce the quantity of petrol purchased (nearest to an integer)?
Solution:
Let the price of petrol be 100x
After increment of 19% price of the petrol = 100x × (119/100) = 119x
The ratio of the price of petrol before and after increment = 100x ∶ 119x
If she intends to spend only an additional 12%, then price of petrol = 100x × (112/100) = 112x
As we know,
Consumption inversely proportional to price, so
The ratio of consumption of petrol before and after increment = 119x ∶ 100x
The ratio of consumption of petrol before and after intends to spend = 119x ∶ 112x
Required percentage = [(119x – 112x)/119x] × 100 = 5.88% or 6% (approx)

Question: When a two-digit number is multiplied by the sum of its digits, the product is 424. When the number obtained by interchanging its digits is multiplied by the sum of the digits, the result is 280. The sum of the digits of the given number is:
Solution:
Let the unit digit number be x and tens digit number be y, then number is 10y + x
According to the question
(10y + x) × (x + y) = 424 ----(1)
(10x + y) × (x + y) = 280 ----(2)
Divide equation (1) by (2)
⇒ (10y + x)/(10x + y) = 424/280
⇒ (10y + x)/(10x + y) = 53/35
We can write
(10y + x)/(10x + y) = (50 + 3)/(30 + 5) (or we can find the value of x and y after solving in detail).
∴ x = 3 and y = 5
Now we can say digit of the number are 5 and 3 so sum of digit = 5 + 3 = 8

Question:
If the volume of a sphere is 4851 cm3, then its surface area (in cm2) is∶
(Take π = 22/7)
If \(\sqrt {10 - 2\sqrt {21} } + \sqrt {8 + 2\sqrt {15} } = \sqrt a + \sqrt b ,\) where a and b are positive integers, then the value of √(ab) is closet to:
Solution:
\(\sqrt {10 - 2\sqrt {21} } + \sqrt {8 + 2\sqrt {15} } = \sqrt a + \sqrt b ,\)
\(\Rightarrow \sqrt {{{\left( {\sqrt 7 } \right)}^2} + {{\left( {\sqrt 3 } \right)}^2} - 2 \times \sqrt 7 \times \sqrt 3 } + \sqrt {{{\left( {\sqrt 5 } \right)}^2} + {{\left( {\sqrt 3 } \right)}^2} + 2 \times \sqrt 5 \times \sqrt 3 } = \sqrt a + \sqrt b ,\)
⇒ √[(√7 – √3)]2 + √[(√5 + √3)]2 = √a + √b
⇒ √7 – √3 + √5 + √3 = √a + √b
⇒ √7 + √5 = √a + √b
On comparing
a = 7 and b = 5
⇒ √ab
⇒ √(7 × 5)
⇒ √35
⇒ 5.9 (approx)

Question: Sujata marks an article 36% above the cost price and allows a 40% discount on the marked price. The loss percentage is∶
Solution:
Let the CP of the article be Rs. x
MP of the article = x × (136/100) = 1.36x
SP of the article = 1.36x × (60/100) = 0.816x
Loss = x – 0.816x = 0.184x
Loss percentage = (0.184x/x) × 100 = 18.4%
Short Trick∶
36 – 40 – (36 × 40)/100
⇒ – 4 – 14.4
⇒ – 18.4%

Question: Two-third of the number of employees of a company are males and the rest are females. If 3/8 of the male employees and 2/5 of the female employees are temporary employees and the total number of permanent employees is 740, then 7/15 of the total number of employees exceeds the number of temporary female employees by:
Solution:
Calculation:
Let the total number of employees be 120 unit
Number of males = 120 × (2/3) = 80 unit
Number of females = 120 – 80 = 40
Number of permanent males = 80 × (5/8) = 50 unit
Number of temporary females = 40 × (2/5) = 16 unit
Number of permanent females = 40 - 16 = 24
Total number of permanent employees = 50 + 24 = 74
According to question,
74 unit = 740
⇒1 unit = 10
⇒ 120 unit = 1200
The total number of employees = 1200
Number of temporary female employees = 16 × 10
⇒ 160
7/15 of total no. of employees = (7/15) × 1200
⇒ 560
7/15 of the total number of employees exceeds the number of temporary female employees = 560 - 160
⇒ 400
∴ 7/15 of the total number of employees exceeds the number of temporary female employees = 400
Alternate Method Let the total employees be x
Number of males = x × (2/3) = 2x/3
Number of females = x × (1/3) = x/3
Number of permanent males = (2x/3) × (5/8) = 5x/12
Number of permanent females = (x/3) × (3/5) = x/5
Number of temporary females = (x/3) × (2/5) = 2x/15
According to the question
5x/12 + x/5 = 740
⇒ (25x + 12x)/60 = 740
⇒ 37x = 740 × 60
⇒ x = (740 × 60)/37 = 1200
Total employees = 1200
7/15 of the total number = 1200 × (7/15) = 560
Number of temporary females = 2/15 × 1200 = 160
∴ Required difference = 560 – 160 = 400

Question: If \(x + \frac{1}{{16x}} = 3\), then the value of \(16{x^3} + \frac{1}{{256{x^3}}}\) is∶
Solution:
x + 1/16x = 3
Multiply by 4
4x + 1/4x = 12
Taking cube on the both sides
(4x + 1/4x)3 = 123
⇒ 64x3 + 1/64x3 + 3(4x + 1/4x) = 1728
⇒ 64x3 + 1/64x3 + 3 × 12 = 1728
⇒ 64x3 + 1/64x3 = 1728 – 36 = 1692
Divided by 4
16x3 + 1/256x3 = 423

Question: What is the compound interest on a sum Rs. 7200 for \(2\frac{2}{5}\) years at 20% p.a interest compounded yearly (nearest to an integer)?
Solution:
As we know,
A = P (1 + r/100)t
Given, P = 7200 , r = 20% and T = \(2\frac{2}{5}\) or 2 years + 2/5 year
Interest rate for 1st and 2nd year = 20%
Interest rate for (2/5) year = 20 × (2/5) = 8%
According to the question
A = 7200 × (120/100) × (120/100) × (108/100)
A = 11,198
Compound interest = 11,198 – 7,200 = 3997
Short Trick:
20% = 1/5 and 8% = 2/25

⇒ 625 unit = 7200
⇒ 1 unit = 7200/625
⇒ 972 – 625 = 347 unit = (7200/625) × 347 = 3997

Question: If x + y + z = 2, xy + yz + zx = -11 and xyz = -12, then what is the value of \(\sqrt {{x^3} + {y^3} + {z^3} - 2}\)?
Solution:
As we know
x3 + y3 + z3 – 3xyz = (x + y +z) [(x + y + z)2 – 3(xy + yz + zx)]
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 – 3 × (–12) = 2[22 – 3 × (– 11)]
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 + 36 = 2[4 + 33]
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 + 36 = 2 × 37
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 = 74 – 36 = 38
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 – 2 = 38 – 2 = 36
∴ √(x3 + y3 + z3 – 2) = √36 = 6

Question: The average of 33 numbers is 74. The average of the first 17 numbers is 72.8 and that of the last 17 numbers is 77.2 If the 17<sup>th</sup> number is excluded, then what will be the average of the remaining numbers (correct to one decimal place)?
Solution:
Sum of 33 number whose average is 74 = 74 × 33 = 2442
Sum of first 17 numbers whose average is 72.8 = 72.8 × 17 = 1237.6
Sum of last 17 number whose average is 77.2 = 77.2 × 17 = 1312.4
17th number = 1312.4 + 1237.6 – 2442 = 108
Sum of 32 numbers = 2442 – 108 = 2334
Average of 32 numbers = 2334/32 = 72.9
Short Trick:
Sum of 33 number whose average is 74 = 74 × 33 = 2442
Average of first 17 numbers = 72.8
Deviation on first 17 numbers = 74 – 72.8 = 1.2 × 17 = 20.4
Average of last 17 numbers = 77.2
Deviation on last 17 numbers = (77.2 – 74) × 17 = 3.2 × 17 = 54.4
17th number = 74 + 54.4 – 20.4 = 108
Sum of 32 numbers = 2442 – 108 = 2334
∴ Average of 32 numbers = 2334/32 = 72.9

Question: The base of a right pyramid is an equilateral triangle with side 8 cm, and the height of the pyramid is 24√3 cm. The volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>) of the pyramid is∶
Solution:
Given:
The base of a right pyramid is an equilateral triangle with side 8 cm, and the height of the pyramid is 24√3 cm.
Formula used:
Volume of pyramid = (1/3) × Area of base × height
Calculation:
As we know,
The volume of any pyramid = (1/3) × Area of base × height
Volume of the pyramid whose base is an equilateral triangle = (1/3) × (√3/4) × 82 × 24√3
⇒ (1/3) × (√3/4) × 8 × 8 × 24√3
⇒ 384 cm3
∴ The volume (in cm3) of the pyramid is 384.

Question: By selling two articles for Rs. 800, a person gains the cost price of three articles. The profit percent is:
Solution:
Calculation:
After selling two articles a person gains the cost price of three articles.
Profit = Selling price - Cost Price
According to the question

⇒ 2 × SP – 2 × CP = 3 × CP

⇒ 2 × SP = 3CP + 2CP
⇒ 2SP = 5CP
SP : CP = 5 : 2
Suppose CP = 2 unit
SP = 5 unit
∴ Profit percentage = [(5 – 2)/2] × 100 = 150%

Question: A man sells his goods at a certain price at 20% profit. If the price at which he buys the goods increases by 10% and he sells them at an 8% higher price, then what will be his profit percent (correct to one decimal place)?
Solution:
Let, initially, the cost price be Rs. 100
SP of the article = 100 × (120/100) = Rs. 120
New CP of the article = 100 × (110/100) = Rs. 110
New SP of the article = 120 × (108/100) = Rs. 129.6
New Profit = 129.6 – 110 = Rs. 19.6
Profit percentage = 19.6/110 × 100 = 17.8%
Note∶ In this question, discrepancy has been found from the side of SSC, the option has been changed accordingly to make this question correct.

Question: The value of (tan29° cot61° – cosec<sup>2</sup>61°) + cot<sup>2</sup>54° – sec<sup>2</sup>36° + (sin<sup>2</sup>1° + sin<sup>2</sup>3° + sin<sup>2</sup>5° + ---------- + sin<sup>2</sup>89°) is:
Solution:
⇒ (tan29° cot61° – cosec261°) + cot254°– sec236° + (sin21° + sin23° + sin25° + ------- -----+ sin289°)
⇒ [cot(90° – 29°) cot61° – cosec261°] + cot254° – cosec2(90° – 36°) + (sin21° + sin23° + sin25° + -------- + cos2(90° – 87°) + cos2(90° – 88°) + cos2(90° – 89°)
⇒ [cot261 – cosec261] + [cot254 – cosec254] + [sin21 + cos21 + sin22 + cos22 +………+ sin243 + cos243 + sin245]
⇒ –1 – 1 + 22 + (1/√2)2
⇒ –2 + 22 + (1/2)
\(\Rightarrow 20\frac{1}{2}\)
Short Trick:
⇒ (sin21° + sin23° + sin25° + ------------ + sin289)
In this type of question find how many terms are there, let the number of terms are n, then answer will be n/2
As we know, in this series there are 45 terms so we can say the answer will be = 45/2 = \(22\frac{1}{2}\)
⇒ [cot261 – cosec261] + [cot254 – cosec254] + [sin21 + cos21 + sin23 + cos23 +………+ sin243 + cos243 + sin245]
⇒ –1 – 1 + 22 + 1/2
\(\Rightarrow 20\frac{1}{2}\)

Question: The graphs of the equations 2x + 3y = 11 and x – 2y + 12 = 0 intersects at P(x<sub>1</sub>, y<sub>1</sub>) and the graph of the equation x – 2y + 12 = 0 intersects the x-axis at Q(x<sub>2</sub>, y<sub>2</sub>). What is the value of (x<sub>1</sub> – x<sub>2</sub> + y<sub>1</sub> + y<sub>2</sub>)?
Solution:
2x + 3y = 11 ----(1)
x – 2y = (– 12) ----(2)
Multiply by 2 in equation (2) and after that subtract equation (2) from equation (1)
7y = 35
⇒ y = 5
From equation (1)
2x + 3 × 5 = 11
⇒ 2x = 11 – 15
⇒ 2x = (– 4)
⇒ x = (– 2)
So, x1 = (– 2) and y1= 5
If equation x – 2y = (– 12) intersects the x-axis at P(x2, y2), then y = 0,
x – 0 = (– 12)
⇒ x = (– 12)
⇒ x2 = (– 12) and y2 = 0
Now, (x1 – x2 + y1 + y2)
⇒ – 2 – (– 12) + 5 + 0
⇒ – 2 + 12 + 5
⇒ 15

Question: Places A and B are 396 km apart. Train X leaves from A for B and train Y leaves from B for A at the same time on the same day on parallel tracks. Both trains meet after \(5\frac{1}{2}\) hours. The speed of Y is 10 km/h more than that of X. What is the speed (in km/h) of Y?
Solution:
Let the speed of X be a km/hr and the speed of y is (a + 10) km/hr.
As we know,
Time × speed = Distance
According to the question
\(5\frac{1}{2} \times \left( {a + a + 10} \right) = 396\)
⇒ (11/2) (2a + 10) = 396
⇒ 2a + 10 = 396 × (2/11) = 72
⇒ 2a = 72 – 10 = 62
⇒ a = 62/2 = 31
∴ Speed of y = 31 + 10 = 41 km/hr

Question: Train A which was travelling at 50 km/h crosses train B travelling in opposite direction in 15 seconds. If the length of train B is three times the length of A and the speed of train B was 58 km/h, then the length of train A(in m) is∶
Solution:
Let the length of the train A be x m
Length of the train B = 3x
Speed of the train A = 50 km/hr
Speed of the train B = 58 km/hr
Effective speed of both train = 50 + 58 = 108 km/hr
As we know,
Speed = Distance/Time
108 × (5/18) = (3x + x)/15
⇒ 30 = 4x/15
⇒ x = 450/4 = 112.5 m

Question: The value of tan<sup>2</sup>ϕ + cot<sup>2</sup>ϕ – sec<sup>2</sup>ϕ cosec<sup>2</sup>ϕ is equal to:
Solution:
As we know,
sec2 – tan2ϕ = 1 and cosec2ϕ – cot2ϕ = 1 and tan ϕ cot ϕ = 1
⇒ tan2ϕ + cot2ϕ – sec2ϕ cosec2ϕ
⇒ tan2ϕ + cosec2ϕ – 1 – sec2ϕ cosec2ϕ
⇒ tan2ϕ – 1 + cosec2ϕ (1 – sec2ϕ)
⇒ tan2ϕ – cosec2ϕ tan2ϕ – 1
⇒ tan2ϕ (1 – cosec2) – 1
⇒ tan2ϕ (–cot2ϕ) – 1
⇒ (–1) – 1
⇒ (–2)

Shortcut Trick
Put, ϕ = 45°
tan245° + cot245° – sec245° × cosec245°
⇒ 1 + 1 – (√2)2 (√2)2
⇒ 1 + 1 – 2 × 2
⇒ 2 – 4
⇒ (–2)

Question: A can do 40% of a work in 12 days, whereas B can do 60% of the same work in 15 days. Both works together for 10 days. C completes the remaining work alone in 4 days. A, B and C together will complete 28% of the same work in∶
Solution:
A can do 40% of a work in = 12 days
A can do whole work (100%) of the work = 12 × (100/40) = 30 days
B can do 60% of a work in = 15 days
B can do whole work (100%) of the work = 15 × (100/60) = 25 days
Let total work = 150
Work done by A and B in 10 days = (5 + 6) × 10 = 110
Remaining work = 150 – 110 = 40
Let efficiency of C be x, then
4x = 40
⇒ x = 40/4 = 10
Efficiency of C is 10
28% of the total work = 150 × (28/100) = 42
28% of the total work A, B and C will complete in = 42/(5 + 6 + 10) = 42/21 = 2 days

Question: The expression \(\sqrt {10 + 2\left( {\sqrt 6 - \sqrt {10} - \sqrt {15} } \right)}\) is equal to:
Solution:
As we know,
(a + b – c)2 = a2 + b2 + c2 + 2 (ab – bc – ca)
\(\sqrt {10 + 2\left( {\sqrt 6 - \sqrt {15} - \sqrt {10} } \right)}\)
\(\Rightarrow \sqrt {{{\left( {\sqrt 3 } \right)}^2} + {{\left( {\sqrt 2 } \right)}^2} + {{\left( {\sqrt 5 } \right)}^2} + 2\left( {\sqrt {3 \times 2} - \sqrt {2 \times 5} - \sqrt {5 \times 3} } \right)}\)
⇒ √[√3 + √2 – √5]2
⇒ (√3 + √2 – √5)

Question: The sides of a triangle are 56 cm, 90 cm and 106 cm. The circumference of its circumcircle is∶
Solution:
As we know
Detailed Solution∶
(Hypotenuse)2 = (Base)2 + (Perpendicular)2
⇒ 1062 = 562 + 902
⇒ 11236 = 3136 + 8100
⇒ 11236 = 11236
Area of right-angled triangle = (1/2) × 90 × 56 = 2520
Radius of circumcircle = abc/(4 × area of triangle) = (106 × 56 × 90)/(4 × 2520) = 53
Circumference of circumcircle = 2πr = 2 × 53 π = 106π
Short trick∶
Now we can say triangle is a right-angled triangle.
Radius of circumcircle = Hypotenuse/2 = 106/2 = 53 cm
Circumference of circumcircle = 2πr = 2 × 53 π = 106π

Question: The number of factors of 3600 is:
Solution:
3600 = 24 × 32 × 52
Total number of factors = (4 + 1) × (2 + 1) × (2 + 1) = 5 × 3 × 3 = 45

Question: If \(\frac{{1\; + \;\sin \phi }}{{1 - \sin \phi }} = \frac{{{p^2}}}{{{q^2}}}\), then sec ϕ is equal to∶
Solution:
\(\frac{{1 + \sin \phi }}{{1 - \sin \phi }} = \frac{{{p^2}}}{{{q^2}}}\)
Dividendo and Componendo
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{}}\frac{{1\; + \;\sin \phi \; + \;1 - \sin \phi }}{{1\; + \;\sin \phi - 1\; + \;\sin \phi }} = \frac{{{p^2}\; + \;{q^2}}}{{{p^2} - {q^2}}}\)
⇒ 1/(sin ϕ) = (p2 + q2)/(p2 – q2)
⇒ sin ϕ = (p2 – q2)/(p2 + q2)
As we know,
Sin2ϕ + cos2 ϕ = 1
⇒ [(p2 – q2)/(p2 + q2)]2 + cos2ϕ = 1
⇒ cos2 ϕ = 1 – [(p2 – q2)/(p2 + q2)]2
⇒ cos2 ϕ = 1 – [(p4 + q4 – 2p2q2)/(p4 + q4 + 2p2q2)]
⇒ cos2 ϕ = [(p4 + q4 + 2p2q2) – (p4 + q4 – 2p2q2)]/(p4 + q4 + 2p2q2)
⇒ cos2 ϕ = 4p2q2/(p2 + q2)2
⇒ cos ϕ = √4p2q2/(p2 + q2)2
⇒ cos ϕ = 2pq/(p2 + q2)
⇒ sec ϕ = (p2 + q2)/2pq
∴ sec ϕ = 1/2 (p/q + q/p)

Question: In ΔABC, the medians AD, BE and CF meet at O. What is the ratio of the area of ΔABD to the area of ΔAOE?
Solution:
As we know, median of the triangle divide the triangle in two equal area, so
ar ΔBOD = ar ΔCOD = ar ΔEOC = ar ΔAOE = ar ΔAOF = ar ΔFOB = 1 unit
Area of ΔABD = ar ΔAOF + ar ΔFOB + ar ΔBOD
Area of ΔABD = 1 + 1 + 1 = 3 unit
Area of ΔAOE = 1 unit
Ratio of ar ΔABD to ar ΔAOE = 3 : 1
Short trick

From figure
ar ΔABD : ar ΔAOE = 3 : 1

Question: If 60% of a number is 120 more than 20% of the number, then 28% of the number is less than \(33\frac{1}{3}\%\) of the number by∶
Solution:
Let number be x, then
x × (60/100) – x × (20/100) = 120
⇒ x × (40/100) = 120
⇒ x = 120 × (100/40) = 300
∴ Number is 300
According to the question
28% of the number is less than 33.33% of the number = (33.33/100) × 300 - (28/100) × 300
⇒ 99.99 - 84 = 16 approximately

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\sin \left( {78^\circ + \theta } \right) - \cos \left( {12^\circ - \theta } \right) + \left( {{{\tan }^2}70^\circ - cose{c^2}20^\circ } \right)}}{{\sin 25^\circ cos65^\circ + \cos 25^\circ \sin 65^\circ }}\) is:
Solution:
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\sin \left( {78^\circ + \theta } \right) - \cos \left( {12^\circ - \theta } \right) + \left( {{{\tan }^2}70^\circ - cose{c^2}20^\circ } \right)}}{{\sin 25^\circ cos65^\circ + \cos 25^\circ \sin 65^\circ }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\sin \left( {78^\circ + \theta } \right) - \sin [90 - \left( {12^\circ - \theta } \right)] + \left( {{{\tan }^2}70^\circ - se{c^2}(90 - 20^\circ } \right)}}{{\sin 25^\circ {\rm{sin}}\left( {90 - 65^\circ } \right) + \cos 25^\circ \cos (90 - 65^\circ )}}\)
⇒ \(\frac{{\sin \left( {78^\circ + \theta } \right) - \sin \left( {78^\circ + \theta } \right) + \left( {{{\tan }^2}70^\circ - se{c^2}70^\circ } \right)}}{{si{n^2}25^\circ + co{s^2}25^\circ }}\)
⇒ (–1)
As we know,
⇒ sin2θ + cos2θ = 1 and tan2θ – sec2θ = (–1)

Question: The base of a right prism is a triangle with sides 20 cm, 21 cm and 29 cm. If its volume is 7560 cm<sup>3</sup>, then its lateral surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) is∶
Solution:
As we know
(Hypotenuse)2 = (Base)2 + (Perpendicular)2
⇒ 292 = 212 + 202
⇒ 841 = 441 + 400
⇒ 841 = 841
Now we can say triangle is a right-angled triangle.
As we know,
Volume of prism = Area of base × height
⇒ (1/2) × 20 × 21 × h = 7560
⇒ h = (7560 × 2)/(20 × 21) = 36 cm
As we know
Lateral surface area of prism = Perimeter of base × Height
Lateral surface area of prism = (29 + 21 + 20) × 36 = 2520 cm2

Question: The sides PQ and PR of ΔPQR are produced to point S and T, respectively. The bisectors of ∠SQR and ∠TRQ meet at U. If ∠QUR = 79° then the measure of ∠P is:
Solution:
Short Trick:
Given, ∠QUR = 79°
If the bisectors of ∠SQR and ∠TRQ meet at U, then
∠QUR = 90° – ∠P/2
79° = 90° – ∠P/2
∠P/2 = 90 – 79 = 11°
∠P = 11° × 2 = 22°
Detailed Solution:
As we know,
∠PQR + ∠RQS = 180°
∠RQS = 180° – ∠PQR
∠RQS/2 = 90° – ∠PQR/2
∠RQU = 90° – ∠PQR/2
Similarly,
∠QRU = 90° – ∠PRQ/2
In ΔQUR
∠RQU + ∠QRU + ∠QUR = 180°
∠QUR = 180° – (∠RQU + ∠QRU)
∠QUR = 180° – [180° – (∠PQR + ∠PRQ)/2]
∠QUR = 180° – [180 – (180° – ∠QPR)/2]
79° = 90° – ∠QPR/2
∠QPR/2 = 90° – 79° = 11°
∠QPR = 11° × 2 = 22°

Question: If (5x + 1)<sup>3</sup> + (x – 3)<sup>3</sup> + 8(3x – 4)<sup>3</sup> = 6(5x + 1) (x – 3) (3x – 4), then x is equal to∶
The HCF of the two numbers is 21 and their LCM is 221 times the HCF. If one of the numbers lies between 200 and 300, then the sum of the digits of the other number is:
Solution:
HCF of two number = 21
LCM of two number = 21 × 221 = 4641
As we know,
First number × Second number = HCF × LCM
Let two number be 21a and 21b respectively, so
21a × 21b = 21 × 4641
⇒ ab = 221
⇒ ab = 13 × 17
Suppose a = 13 and b = 17
The first number = 21a = 21 × 13 = 273
Second number = 21b = 21 × 17 = 357
So, sum of digit of 357 = 3 + 5 + 7 = 15.

Question: If 3(cot<sup>2</sup> ϕ – cos<sup>2</sup> ϕ) = cos<sup>2</sup> ϕ, 0° < ϕ < 90°, then the value of (tan<sup>2</sup> ϕ + cosec<sup>2</sup> ϕ + sin<sup>2</sup> ϕ) is∶
Solution:
Short trick∶
3(cot2 ϕ – cos2 ϕ) = cos2 ϕ
If 0° < ϕ < 90°, so put ϕ = 30, 45 and 60
Put ϕ = 60
⇒ 3(cot2 60 – cos2 60) = cos2 60
⇒ 3 (1/3 – 1/4) = 1/4
⇒ 3 × (1/12) = 1/4
⇒ 1/4 = 1/4 (satisfied)
Now,
(tan2 ϕ + cosec2 ϕ + sin2 ϕ)
⇒ tan2 60 + cosec2 60 + sin2 60
⇒ (√3)2 + (2/√3)2 + (√3/2)2
⇒ 3 + 4/3 + 3/4
⇒ (36 + 16 + 9)/12
⇒ 61/12
Detailed Solution∶
3(cot2 ϕ – cos2 ϕ) = cos2 ϕ
⇒ 3 cos2 (1/sin2 ϕ – 1) = cos2 ϕ
⇒ cosec2 ϕ – 1 = 1/3
⇒ cot2 ϕ = 1/3
⇒ cot ϕ = 1/√3
⇒ cot ϕ = cot 60
⇒ ϕ = 60
Now,
(tan2 ϕ + cosec2 ϕ + sin2 ϕ)
⇒ tan2 60 + cosec2 60 + sin2 60
⇒ (√3)2 + (2/√3)2 + (√3/2)2
⇒ 3 + 4/3 + 3/4
⇒ (36 + 16 + 9)/12
⇒ 61/12

Question: In ΔABC, the perpendiculars are drawn from A, B and C to meet the opposite sides at D, E and F, respectively AD, BE and CF intersect at point p. If ∠EPD = 116° and the bisectors of ∠A and ∠B meet at Q, then the measure of ∠AQB is:
Solution:
Given, ∠EPD = 116°
As we know,
∠PEC = ∠PDC = 90°
In quadrilateral PECD
⇒ ∠PEC + ∠PDC + ∠EPD + ∠ECD = 360
⇒ ∠ECD = 360° – 116° – 90° – 90° = 64
In ΔABQ
∠A/2 + ∠B/2 + ∠Q = 180°
⇒ ∠Q = 180° – (∠B + ∠A)/2
⇒ ∠Q = 180° – [(180° – ∠C)/2]
⇒ ∠Q = 180° – 90° + ∠C/2
⇒ ∠Q = 90° + 64/2
⇒ ∠Q = 90° + 32° = 122°
Short trick
As we know,
⇒ ∠C + ∠EPD = 180°
⇒ ∠C = 180° – 116° = 64°
Again, As we know,
⇒ ∠AQB = 90° + ∠C/2
⇒ ∠AQB = 90° + 64°/2 = 90° + 32° = 122°

Question: In ΔPQR, I is the in-centre of the triangle. If ∠QIR = 107°, then what is the measure of ∠P?
Solution:
Short Trick∶
As we know,
∠QIR = 90° + ∠P/2
⇒ 107° = 90° + ∠P/2
⇒ ∠P/2 = 107° – 90° = 17°
⇒ ∠P = 2 × 17° = 34°
Detailed Solution∶
In ΔQIR
∠Q/2 + ∠R/2 + ∠QIR = 180°
⇒ ∠QIR = 180° – ∠Q/2 – ∠R/2
⇒ ∠QIR = 180° – (180° – ∠P)/2
⇒ ∠QIR = 180° – 90° + ∠P/2
⇒ ∠QIR = 90° + ∠P/2
⇒ 107° = 90° + ∠P/2
⇒ ∠P/2 = 107° – 90° = 17°
⇒ ∠P = 2 × 17° = 34°

Question: The sum of the interior angles of a regular polygon is 1260°. What is the difference between an exterior angle and an interior angle of the polygon?
Solution:
As we know,
If n = total number of sides of a regular polygon, then
Sum of interior angles of the polygon = [(n – 2) × 180]
[(n – 2) × 180] = 1260
⇒ (n – 2) = 1260/180
⇒ (n – 2) = 7
⇒ n = 7 + 2 = 9
As we know,
Each interior angles of the polygon = 1260/9 = 140°
Each exterior angles of the polygon = 180 – 140 = 40°
Required difference = 140° - 40° = 100°

Question: In a circle, AB and DC are two chords. When AB and DC are produced, they meet at P. If PC = 5.6 cm, PB = 6.3 cm and AB = 7.7 cm, then the length of CD is∶
Solution:
Given, PC = 5.6, PB = 6.3, AB = 7.7
PA = PB + AB = 6.3 + 7.7 = 14
As we know,
PC × PD = PB × PA
⇒ 5.6 × PD = 6.3 × 14
⇒ PD = (6.3 × 14)/5.6
⇒ PD = 15.75
⇒ PD = PC + CD
⇒ 15.75 = 5.6 + CD
∴ CD = 15.75 – 5.6 = 10.15 cm

Question: If \(\frac{{{{\sin }^2}\phi - 3sin\;\phi + 2}}{{{{\cos }^2}\phi }} = 1,\) where 0° < ϕ < 90°, then what is the value of (cos2ϕ + sin3ϕ + cosec2ϕ)?
Solution:
If 0° < ϕ < 90°, then put any value between 0 and 90 so that equation satisfied.
So, put ϕ = 30°
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{{{\sin }^2}\phi - 3sin\;\phi + 2}}{{{{\cos }^2}\phi }} = 1\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{{{\sin }^2}30^\circ - 3sin\;30^\circ + 2}}{{{{\cos }^2}30^\circ }} = 1\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\frac{1}{4} - \frac{3}{2} + \;2}}{{\frac{3}{4}}} = 1\)
⇒ [(1 – 6 + 8)/4] / [3/4] = 1
⇒ (3/4) × (4/3) = 1
⇒ 1 = 1 (satisfied)
Now, (cos2ϕ + sin3ϕ + cosec2ϕ)
⇒ (cos60° + sin90° + cosec60°)
⇒ (1/2) + 1 + (2/√3)
⇒ (3 + 6 + 4√3)/6
⇒ (9 + 4√3)/6
Detailed Solution:
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{{{\sin }^2}\phi - 3sin\;\phi + 2}}{{{{\cos }^2}\phi }} = 1\)
⇒ sin2ϕ – 3sinϕ + 2 = cos2ϕ
⇒ sin2ϕ – 3sinϕ + 2 = 1 – sin2ϕ
⇒ 2 sin2ϕ – 3sin ϕ + 1 = 0
⇒ 2 sin2 ϕ – 2sin ϕ - sin ϕ + 1 = 0
⇒ 2sin ϕ(sin ϕ – 1) – 1(sin ϕ – 1) =0
⇒ (sin ϕ – 1)(2sin ϕ – 1) = 0
So,
⇒ sin ϕ = 1 and sin ϕ = 1/2
Given, 0° < ϕ < 90°, so
Taking
sin ϕ = 1/2
sin ϕ = sin 30°
ϕ = 30°
Now, (cos2ϕ + sin3ϕ + cosec2ϕ)
(cos60° + sin90° + cosec60°)
⇒ (1/2) + 1 + (2/√3)
⇒ (3 + 6 + 4√3)/6
⇒ (9 + 4√3)/6

Question: The value of \(\sqrt {\frac{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}{{cosec\;\phi \; + \;\cot \phi }}} \div \frac{{\sin \phi }}{{1\; + \;\cos \phi }}\) is equal to∶
Solution:
Short trick∶
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\sqrt {\frac{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}{{cosec\;\phi \; + \;\cot \phi }}} \div \frac{{\sin \phi }}{{1\; + \;\cos \phi }}\)
Put ϕ = 45
⇒ √[(cosec 45 – cot 45)/(cosec 45 + cot 45)] ÷ [sin 45/(1 + cos 45)]
⇒ √(√2 – 1)/(√2 + 1) ÷ [(1/√2)/(1 + 1/√2)]
⇒ (√2 – 1) ÷ 1/(√2 + 1)
⇒ (√2 – 1) × (√2 + 1)
⇒ 2 – 1
⇒ 1
Detailed solution∶
\(\sqrt {\frac{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}{{cosec\;\phi \; + \;\cot \phi }}} \div \frac{{\sin \phi }}{{1\; + \;\cos \phi }}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\sqrt {\frac{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}{{cosec\;\phi \; + \;\cot \phi }}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}{{cosec\;\phi - \cot \phi }}\;} \div \frac{{\sin \phi }}{{1\; + \;\cos \phi }}\)
⇒ √(cosec ϕ – cot ϕ)2/(cosec2 ϕ – cot2ϕ) ÷ [sin ϕ/(1 + cos ϕ)]
⇒ (cosec ϕ – cot ϕ) ÷ [sin ϕ/(1 + cos ϕ)]
⇒ (1/sin ϕ – cos ϕ/sin ϕ) ÷ [sin ϕ/(1 + cos ϕ)]
⇒ [(1 – cos ϕ)/sin ϕ] ÷ [sin ϕ/(1 + cos ϕ)]
⇒ [(1 – cos ϕ)/sin ϕ] × [(1 + cos ϕ)/sin ϕ]
⇒ (1 – cos2 ϕ)/sin2 ϕ
⇒ sin2 ϕ/sin2 ϕ
⇒ 1

Question:
A field roller, in the shape of a cylinder, has a diameter of 1 m and length of \(1\frac{1}{4}\) m.
If the speed at which the roller rolls is 14 revolutions per minute, then the maximum area (in m2) that it can roll in 1 hour is: (Take π = 22/7)
Solution:
As we know,
Curved surface area of cylinder = 2 πrh
Radius of roller (r) = 1/2 m
Length of roller (h) = \(1\frac{1}{4} = \frac{5}{4}\;\) m
Curved surface area of cylinder = 2 πrh = 2 × (22/7) × (1/2) × (5/4) m2
Total surface area covered in 1 hour = 2 × (22/7) × (1/2) × (5/4) × 14 × 60 = 3300 m2

Question: A solid metallic sphere of radius 8 cm is melted and drawn into a wire of uniform cross-section. If the length of the wire is 24 m, then its radius (in mm) is∶
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of sphere = (4/3) πR3
Radius of sphere (R) = 8 cm
Length of wire = 24 m = 2400 cm
Let radius of wire = r cm
According to the question
πr2 × 2400 = (4/3) × π × 83
⇒ r2 = (4 × 8 × 8 × 8)/(3 × 2400)
⇒ r2 = (8 × 8)/(3 × 3 × 5 × 5)
⇒ r = √(8 × 8)/(3 × 3 × 5 × 5) = 8/(3 × 5) = 8/15 cm
⇒ r = (8/15) × 10 = 16/3 mm = 5\(\frac{1}{3}\) mm

Question: From a point exactly midway between the foot of two towers P and Q, the angles of elevation of their tops are 30° and 60°, respectively. The ratio of the height of P to that of Q is:
Solution:
Let the height of tower P and tower Q be AB and CE and D is the midpoint of BE.
BD = DE
In ΔABD
tan 30° = AB/BD
⇒ 1/√3 = AB/BD
AB = BD/√3
In ΔCDE
tan 60° = CE/DE
⇒ √3 = CE/DE
CE = √3DE
Ratio of height of tower P and Q = AB : CE = BD/√3 : √3DE = DE/√3 : √3DE = 1/√3 : √3
⇒ 1 : 3
Short trick

From the figure
AB : CE = 1 : 3

Question: The value of \(\left( {1\frac{1}{3} \div 2\frac{6}{7}\;of\;5\frac{3}{5}} \right) \div \left( {6\frac{2}{5} \div 4\frac{1}{2}\;of\;5\frac{1}{3}} \right) \times \left( {\frac{3}{4} \times 2\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{5}{9}\;of\;1\frac{1}{5}} \right) = 1 + k,\) where k lies between∶
Solution:
Follow BODMAS rule to solve this question, as per the order given below∶
Step-1∶ Parts of an equation enclosed in 'Brackets' must be solved first, and in the bracket,
Step-2∶ Any mathematical 'Of' or 'Exponent' must be solved next,
Step-3∶ Next, the parts of the equation that contain 'Division' and 'Multiplication' are calculated,
Step-4∶ Last but not least, the parts of the equation that contain 'Addition' and 'Subtraction' should be calculated.
\(\Rightarrow \left( {\frac{4}{3} \div \frac{{20}}{7}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{{28}}{5}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{32}}{5} \div \frac{9}{2}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{{16}}{3}} \right){\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\left( {\frac{3}{4}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{8}{3} \div \frac{5}{9}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{6}{5}} \right){\rm{}} = {\rm{}}1{\rm{}} + {\rm{\;k\;}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \left( {\frac{4}{3} \div 16} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{32}}{5} \div 24} \right){\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\left( {\frac{3}{4}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{8}{3} \div \frac{2}{3}} \right){\rm{}} = {\rm{}}1{\rm{}} + {\rm{\;k\;}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \left( {\frac{4}{3}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{1}{{16}}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{32}}{5}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{1}{{24}}} \right){\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\left( {\frac{3}{4}{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}\frac{8}{3}{\rm{}} \times {\rm{}}\frac{3}{2}} \right)1{\rm{}} + {\rm{\;k\;}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{1}{{12}} \div \frac{4}{{15}}{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}3{\rm{}} = {\rm{}}1{\rm{}} + {\rm{\;k}}\)
⇒ (1/12) × (15/4) × 3 = 1 + k
⇒ 15/16 = 1 + k
⇒ k = 15/16 – 1
⇒ k = – 1/16
⇒ k = – 0.0625
So, number lies between (– 0.07 and – 0.06)

Question: In ΔABC, AB = AC and D is a point on BC. If BD = 5 cm, AB = 12 cm and AD = 8 cm, then the length of CD is∶
Solution:
If AC = AB, then ∠ABC = ∠ACB
Let ∠ABC = ∠ACB = θ and DC = x
In ΔABD
cos θ = (AB2 + BD2 – AD2)/(2 × AB × BD)
cos θ = (122 + 52 – 82)/(2 × 12 × 5) ----(1)
In ΔADC
cos θ = (AC2 + DC2 – AD2)/(2 × AC × DC)
cos θ = (122 + x2 – 82)/(2 × 12 × x) ----(2)
From equation (1) and equation (2)
(122 + 52 – 82)/(2 × 12 × 5) = (122 + x2 – 82)/(2 × 12 × x)
⇒ (144 + 25 – 64)/5 = (144 + x2 – 64)/x
⇒ 21x = 80 + x2
⇒ x2 – 21x + 80 = 0
⇒ x2 – 16x – 5x + 80 = 0
⇒ x (x – 16) – 5(x – 16) = 0
⇒ (x – 16) (x – 5) = 0
So, x = 16 and 5
So, the value of x = 16
Length of CD = 16 cm
Confusion Points SAS property of congruency cannot be applied over here because the angle should be adjacent to both sides to use SAS and in this figure that is not the case.

Question: A cylindrical vessel of radius 3.5 m is full of water. If 15400 litres of water is taken out from it, then the drop in the water level in the vessel will be:
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of cylinder = πr2h
Let h m water level drop after taking out 15400 litres of water in the vessel.
Radius of cylinder (r) = 3.5 m
According to the question
πr2h = 15400/1000
⇒ (22/7) × 3.5 × 3.5 × h = 15.4
⇒ h = (15.4 × 7)/(3.5 × 3.5 × 22) = 0.4 m
⇒ h = 0.4 × 100 = 40 cm

Question: A man starts from his house and travelling at 30 km/h, he reaches his office late by 10 minutes, and travelling at 24 km/h, he reaches his office late by 18 minutes. The distance (in km) from his house to his office is∶
Solution:
As we know,
Distance = Time × Speed
Let correct taking time to reach his office be x hr
30 × (x + 10/60) = 24 × (x + 18/60)
⇒ 30x + 5 = 24x + 36/5
⇒ 30x – 24x = 36/5 – 5
⇒ 6x = 11/5
⇒ x = 11/30 hr
Required distance = 30 × (11/30 + 10/60) = 30 × (22 + 10)/60 = 16 km

Question: If the diameter of the base of a right circular cylinder is reduced by \(33\frac{1}{3}\%\) and its height is doubled, then the volume of the cylinder will:
Solution:
Let the radius of the cylinder be r cm and height of the cylinder be h cm
As we know,
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h
If the radius of the cylinder decreased by \(33\frac{1}{3}\%\), then new radius of the cylinder = r × (2/3) = 2r/3
If the height of the cylinder increased by 100% then the new height of the cylinder = h × (200/100) = 2h
New volume of the cylinder = π (2r/3)2× 2h = 8πr2h/9
Volume decreased by = πr2h – 8πr2h/9 = πr2h/9
Volume decreased by (in %) = [πr2h/9πr2h] × 100 = \(11\frac{1}{9}\%\)
Short Trick:
\(33\frac{1}{3}\%\) = 1/3
Let height be 1 unit after increment height will be 2 unit, then

∴ Required percentage = [(9 – 8)/9] × 100 = \(11\frac{1}{9}\%\) (decrease)

Question: A sum amounts to Rs. 14,395.20 at 9.25% p.a. simple interest in 5.4 years. What will be the simple interest on the same sum at 8.6% p.a. in 4.5 years?
A solid cube is cut into three cuboids of same volumes. What is the ratio of the surface area of the cube to the sum of the surface areas of any two of the cuboids so formed?
Solution:
Let side of the cube be 3 unit
Length of newly formed cuboid l = 3
Breadth of newly formed cuboid b = 3
Height of newly formed cuboid h = 1
Total surface area of cube = 6 × a2 = 6 × 3 × 3 = 54
Total surface area of cuboid = 2 (lb + bh + hl) = 2 (3 × 3 + 3 × 1 + 1 × 3) = 2 × (9 + 3 + 3) = 2 × 15 = 30
Total surface area of two cuboid = 2 × 30 = 60
∴ Required ratio = 54 : 60 = 9 : 10

Question: 40 litres of 60% concentration of an acid solution is added to 35 litres of 80% concentration of the acid solution. What is the concentration of acid in the new solution?
Solution:
Short Trick∶

⇒ 8 + 7 = 15 units = 20
⇒ 1 unit = 20/15
⇒ 8 unit = (20 × 8)/15 = 32/3 = 10\(\frac{2}{3}\)
⇒ 7 units = (20 × 7)/15 = 28/3 = 9\(\frac{1}{3}\)
Detailed solution∶
Quantity of acid in 40 litres = 40 × (60/100) = 24 litres
Quantity of acid in 35 litres = 35 × (80/100) = 28 litres
Total quantity of acid in both solution = 24 + 28 = 52 litres
Total quantity of both solution = 40 + 35 = 75 litres
Percentage of acid in new solution = (52/75) × 100 = \(69\frac{1}{3}\%\)

Question: The value of \(0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + 0.3\bar 9 \times 0.\bar 7\) is:
Solution:
\(0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + 0.3\bar 9 \times 0.\bar 7\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + \frac{{39 - 3}}{{90}} \times \frac{7}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + \frac{{36}}{{90}} \times \frac{7}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + \frac{{28}}{{90}}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + 0.3\bar 1\) (see figure)

\(\therefore 0.1\overline {54}\)
Or we can solve it with another method
\(\Rightarrow 0.5\bar 6 - 0.7\overline {23} + 0.3\bar 9 \times 0.\bar 7\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{56 - 5}}{{90}} - \frac{{723 - 7}}{{990}} + \frac{{39 - 3}}{{90}} \times \frac{7}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{51}}{{90}} - \frac{{716}}{{990}} + \frac{{36}}{{90}} \times \frac{7}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{51}}{{90}} - \frac{{716}}{{990}} + \frac{{28}}{{90}}\)
⇒ (561 – 716 + 308) /990
⇒ 153/990
\(\Rightarrow 0.1\overline {54}\)

Question: The area of the base of a right circular cone is 400π and its height is 15 cm. The curved surface area of the cone (in cm<sup>2</sup>) is∶
Solution:
Given, height of the cone h = 15 cm
As we know,
Curved surface area of cone = πrl
Volume of cone = (1/3) πr2h
Base area of cone = 400π
πr2 = 400π
⇒ r2 = 400
⇒ r = √400 = √(20 × 20) = 20
As we know,
l2 = r2 + h2
⇒ l2 = 202 + 152 = 400 + 225 = 625
⇒ l = √625 = √(25 × 25) = 25
Curved surface area of cone = πrl = 20 × 25 × π = 500π

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\sec \phi \left( {1 - \sin \phi } \right)\left( {\sin \phi + \cos \phi } \right)\left( {sec\phi + \tan \phi } \right)}}{{\sin \phi \left( {1 + \tan \phi } \right) + \cos \phi \left( {1 + \cot \phi } \right)}}\) is equal to:
Solution:
Short Trick:
\(\frac{{\sec \phi \left( {1 - \sin \phi } \right)\left( {\sin \phi + \cos \phi } \right)\left( {sec\phi + \tan \phi } \right)}}{{\sin \phi \left( {1 + \tan \phi } \right) + \cos \phi \left( {1 + \cot \phi } \right)}}\)
Put ϕ = 45°
\(\frac{{\sec 45\left( {1 - \sin 45} \right)\left( {\sin 45 + \cos 45} \right)\left( {sec45 + \tan 45} \right)}}{{\sin 45\left( {1 + \tan 45} \right) + \cos 45\left( {1 + \cot 45} \right)}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\sqrt 2 \left( {1 - \frac{1}{{\sqrt 2 }}} \right) \times \frac{2}{{\sqrt 2 }} \times \left( {\sqrt 2 + 1} \right)}}{{2 \times \frac{1}{{\sqrt 2 }} \times \left( {1 + 1} \right)}} = \frac{{\left( {\sqrt 2 - 1} \right) \times \sqrt 2 \times \left( {\sqrt 2 + 1} \right)}}{{2\sqrt 2 }} = \frac{1}{2}\)
With the help of option 3
⇒ sinϕ cosϕ
⇒ sin45 cos45
⇒ (1/√2) × (1/√2)
⇒ 1/2 (satisfied)
Detailed Solution:
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\sec \phi \left( {1 - \sin \phi } \right)\left( {\sin \phi + \cos \phi } \right)\left( {sec\phi + \tan \phi } \right)}}{{\sin \phi \left( {1 + \tan \phi } \right) + \cos \phi \left( {1 + \cot \phi } \right)}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{(\sec \phi - tan\phi )\left( {\sin \phi + \cos \phi } \right)\left( {sec\phi + \tan \phi } \right)}}{{\sin \phi \left( {1 + \frac{{sin\phi }}{{cos\phi }}} \right) + \cos \phi \left( {1 + \frac{{cos\phi }}{{sin\phi }}} \right)}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{({{\sec }^2}\phi - {{\tan }^2}\phi )\left( {\sin \phi + \cos \phi } \right)}}{{\frac{{\sin \phi \left( {sin\phi + cos\phi } \right)}}{{cos\phi }} + \frac{{cos\phi \left( {sin\phi + cos\phi } \right)}}{{sin\phi }}}} = \frac{{\left( {sin\phi + cos\phi } \right)}}{{\left( {sin\phi + cos\phi } \right)\left( {tan\phi + cot\phi } \right)}} = \frac{1}{{tan\phi + cot\phi }}\)
⇒ 1/(sinϕ/cosϕ + cosϕ/sinϕ)
⇒ 1/(sin2ϕ + cos2ϕ)/sinϕcosϕ
⇒ sinϕ cosϕ
As we know,
⇒ sin2ϕ + cos2ϕ = 1 and sec2 ϕ – tan2ϕ = 1

Question: A right circular solid cone of radius 3.2 cm and height 7.2 cm is melted and recast into a right circular cylinder of height 9.6 cm. What is the diameter of the base of the cylinder?
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of cone = (1/3) πr2h
Volume of cylinder = πR2H
Radius of cone (r) = 3.2 cm
Height of cone (h) = 7.2 cm
Height of cylinder (H) = 9.6 cm
Radius of cylinder = R
According to the question
πR2H = (1/3) πr2h
⇒ R2 × 9.6 = (1/3) × 3.2 × 3.2 × 7.2
⇒ R2 = (3.2 × 3.2 × 7.2)/(3 × 9.6) = (3.2 × 3.2)/4
⇒ R = √(3.2 × 3.2)/4 = 3.2/2 = 1.6
Diameter of the cylinder = 2 × 1.6 = 3.2

Question: 4 men and 5 women can complete a work in 15 days, whereas 9 men and 6 women can do it in 10 days. To complete the same work in 7 days, how many women should assist 4 men?
Solution:
According to the question
Total work = Total work
⇒ (4m + 5w) × 15 = (9m + 6w) × 10
⇒ (4m + 5w) × 3 = (9m + 6w) × 2
⇒ 12m + 15w = 18m + 12w
⇒ 15w – 12w = 18m – 12m
⇒ 3w = 6m
⇒ w : m = 2 : 1
Total work = (4m + 5w) × 15 = (4 × 1 + 5 × 2) × 10 = (4 + 10) × 15 = 14 × 15 = 210
Let x women assist 4 men to complete the work in 7 days, then
(4 × 1 + x × 2) × 7 = 210
⇒ 4 + 2x = 210/7 = 30
⇒ 2x = 30 – 4 = 26
⇒ x = 26/2 = 13

Question: (sec ϕ – tan ϕ)<sup>2</sup> (1 + sin ϕ)<sup>2</sup> ÷ sin<sup>2</sup> ϕ = ?
Solution:
Detailed Solution∶
(sec ϕ – tan ϕ)2 (1 + sin ϕ)2 ÷ sin2 ϕ
⇒ (1/cos ϕ - sin ϕ/cos ϕ)2 (1 + sin ϕ)2 ÷ sin2ϕ
⇒ (1/cos2 ϕ (1 – sin ϕ)2 (1 + sin ϕ)2 ÷ sin2 ϕ
⇒ 1/cos2 ϕ (1 – sin2 ϕ)2 ÷ sin2 ϕ
⇒ 1/cos2 ϕ (cos2 ϕ)2 ÷ sin2 ϕ
⇒ cos2ϕ/sin2ϕ
⇒ cot2ϕ
Short Trick∶
(sec ϕ – tan ϕ)2 (1 + sin ϕ)2 ÷ sin2 ϕ
Put ϕ = 45
⇒ (√2 – 1)2 (1 + 1/√2)2 ÷ (1/2)
⇒ (√2 – 1)2 (√2 + 1)2/2 ÷ (1/2)
⇒ (2 – 1)2/2 × 2
⇒ (1/2) × 2
⇒ 1
With the help of option 4
cot ϕ
⇒ cot 45
⇒ 1 (satisfied)

Question: The value of \(\left( {\frac{{sinA}}{{1 - cosA}} + \frac{{1 - cosA}}{{sinA}}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{{{\cot }^2}A}}{{1 + cosecA}} + 1} \right)\) is:
Solution:
Detailed Solution:
\(\begin{array}{l} \left( {\frac{{sinA}}{{1 - cosA}} + \frac{{1 - cosA}}{{sinA}}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{{{\cot }^2}A}}{{1 + cosecA}} + 1} \right)\\ \Rightarrow \left( {\frac{{{{\sin }^2}A + {{\left( {1 - cosA} \right)}^2}}}{{sinA\left( {1 - cosA} \right)}}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{{\rm{cose}}{{\rm{c}}^2}A - 1}}{{1 + cosecA}} + 1} \right)\\ \Rightarrow \left( {\frac{{{{\sin }^2}A + 1 + {{\cos }^2}A - 2cosA}}{{sinA\left( {1 - cosA} \right)}}} \right) \div \left( {cosecA - 1 + 1} \right) \end{array}\)
⇒ [(2 – 2cosA)/sinA(1 – cosA)] ÷ cosecA
⇒ [2(1 – cosA)/sinA(1 – cosA)] ÷ cosecA
⇒ 2cosecA ÷ cosecA
⇒ 2
Short trick:
Put θ = 45°
\(\begin{array}{l} \left( {\frac{{sin45^\circ }}{{1 - cos45^\circ }} + \frac{{1 - cos45^\circ }}{{sin45^\circ }}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{{{{\cot }^2}45^\circ }}{{1 + cosec45^\circ }} + 1} \right)\\ \Rightarrow \left( {\frac{{\frac{1}{{√ 2 }}}}{{1 - {\rm{\;}}\frac{1}{{√ 2 }}}} + \frac{{1 - \frac{1}{{√ 2 }}}}{{\frac{1}{{√ 2 }}}}} \right) \div \left( {\frac{1}{{1 + √ 2 }} + 1} \right)\\ \Rightarrow \left( {\frac{1}{{√ 2 - 1}} + √ 2 - {\rm{\;}}1} \right) \div \left( {√ 2 - {\rm{\;}}1 + 1} \right) \end{array}\)
⇒ (√2 + 1 + √2 – 1) ÷ √2
⇒ 2√2 ÷ √2
⇒ 2

Question: Alloy A contains copper and zinc in the ratio of 4 ∶ 3 and alloy B contains copper and zinc in the ratio 5 ∶ 2. A and B are taken in the ratio of 5 ∶ 6 and melted to form a new alloy. The percentage of zinc in the new alloy is closest to∶
Solution:
Ratio of copper to zinc in alloy A = 4x ∶ 3x ----(1)
Ratio of copper to zinc in alloy B = 5x ∶ 2x ----(2)
Multiply by 5 in equation (1) and multiply by 6 in equation (2)
Ratio of copper to zinc in alloy A = 20x ∶ 15x
Ratio of copper to zinc in alloy B = 30x ∶ 12x
Ratio of copper to zinc in new alloy = (20x + 30x) ∶ (15x ∶ 12x) = 50x ∶ 27x
Percentage of zinc in new alloy = [27/(50 + 27)] × 100 = 35% (approx)

Question: The perimeters of two similar triangles ABC and PQR 78 cm and 46.8 cm. respectively. If PQ = 11.7 then the length of AB is:
Solution:
Given,
ΔABC ∼ ΔPQR
Perimeter of ΔABC/Perimeter of ΔPQR = AB/PQ
⇒ 78/46.8 = AB/11.7
⇒ AB = (78/46.8) × 11.7 = 19.5

Question: 5 years ago, the ratio of the age of A to that of B was 4 ∶ 5. Five years hence, the ratio of the age of A to that of B will be 6 ∶ 7. If, at present, C is 10 years younger than B, then what will be the ratio of the present age of A to that of C?
Solution:
Let 5 years ago age of A to B = 4x ∶ 5x
According to the question
⇒ (4x + 10)/(5x + 10) = 6/7
⇒ 7(4x + 10) = 6(5x + 10)
⇒ 28x + 70 = 30x + 60
⇒ 30x – 28x = 70 – 60
⇒ 2x = 10
⇒ x = 10/2 = 5
5 years ago, age of A = 4x = 4 × 5 = 20
Present age of A = 20 + 5 = 25 years
5 years ago, age of B = 5x = 5 × 5 = 25
Present age of B = 25 + 5 = 30
Present age of C = 30 – 10 = 20
Ratio of present age of A to C = 25 ∶ 20 = 5 ∶ 4

Question: In a quadrilateral ABCD, the bisectors of ∠C and ∠D meet at E. If ∠CED = 56° and ∠A = 49°, then the measure of ∠B is∶
Solution:
Shortcut Trick
As we know,
∠A + ∠B = 2∠CED
⇒ 49° + ∠B = 2 × 56°
⇒ ∠B = 112° – 49° = 63°
Detailed Solution∶
In ΔCED
∠C/2 + ∠D/2 + ∠CED = 180°
⇒ ∠C/2 + ∠D/2 + 56° = 180°
⇒ ∠C/2 + ∠D/2 = 180° – 56° = 124°
⇒ ∠C + ∠D = 124° × 2 = 248°
As we know,
∠A + ∠B + ∠C + ∠D = 360°
⇒ 49° + ∠B + 248° = 360°
⇒ ∠B = 360° – 297° = 63°

Question: An article is sold at a certain price. If it is sold at 80% of this price, then there will be a loss of 10%. What is the percent profit when the article is sold at the original selling price?
Solution:
Let the original price of the article be 100x.
SP of the article = 100x × (80/100) = 80x
CP of the article = 80x × (100/90) = 800x/9
If the article sold at original price, then
profit = 100x – 800x/9 = (900x – 800x)/9 = 100x/9
Profit percentage = [(100x/9)/(800x)/9] × 100 = \(12\frac{1}{2}\%\) a
Short tick:
Let the original price of the article be 45
SP of the article = 45 × (4/5) = 36
CP of the article = 36 × (10/9) = 40
Profit if article sold at original price = 45 – 40 = 5
Profit percentage = (5/40) × 100 = 12.5%

Question: A spends 65% of his income. His income is increased by 20.1% and his expenditure is increased by 25%. His saving∶
Solution:
Given:
A spends 65% of his income
His income is increased by 20.1% and his expenditure is increased by 25%.
Solution:
Let income of A be 100x
Expenditure of A = 100x × (65/100) = 65x
Savings of A = 100x – 65x = 35x
Let his income increased by 20.1%
His new income = 100x × (120.1/100) = 120.1x
His new expenditure = 65x × (125/100) = 81.25x
His new savings = 120.1x – 81.25x = 38.85x
His saving increased by = [(38.85x – 35x)/35x] × 100 = 11%
∴ His saving increased by 11%.

Question: A loan has to be returned in two equal yearly instalments each of Rs. 44,100. If the rate of interest is 5% p.a compounded annually, the total interest paid is:
Solution:
As we know,
Formulae for installments in case of compound interest is
P = x/(1 + r/100) + x/(1 + r/100)2 ....x/(1 + r/100)n
Given, (each installment) x = 44,100, r = 5%, n = 2 and P = ?
⇒ P = x/(1 + r/100) + x/(1 + r/100)2
⇒ P = 44,100/(1 + 5/100) + 44,100/(1 + 5/100)2
⇒ P = [44,100 × (20/21)] + [44,100 × (20/21) × (20/21)]
⇒ P = 42,000 + 40,000 = 82,000
Total Rs. paid = 44,100 × 2 = 88,200
Interest paid = 88,200 – 82,000 = 6,200
Short Trick:
5% = 1/20

Total instalment = 44,100 × 2 = 88,200
882 unit = 88200
⇒ 1 unit = 100
⇒ (882 – 820 = 62 unit) = 62 × 100 = 6200

Question:

Question:
If 320 units of product A were sold by the company, then how many units of products B and E together were sold by the company?
Solution:
Let the total unit sold by all five products be x unit.
Number of units sold of product A = 320
x × (50/360) = 320
x = 320 × (360/50) = 2304
Unit sold of products B and E together = 2304 × [(35° + 55°)/360°] = 576°
Short Trick∶
50° represents = 320 unit
35° + 55° = 90° will represent = (320/50) × 90 = 576 unit

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\left( {0.545} \right)\left( {0.081} \right)\left( {0.51} \right)\left( {5.2} \right)}}{{{{\left( {0.324} \right)}^3} + {{\left( {0.221} \right)}^3} - {{\left( {0.545} \right)}^3}}}\) is:
Solution:
As we know,
If a + b + c = 0, then a3 + b3 + c3 = 3abc
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {0.545} \right)\left( {0.081} \right)\left( {0.51} \right)\left( {5.2} \right)}}{{{{\left( {0.324} \right)}^3} + {{\left( {0.221} \right)}^3} - {{\left( {0.545} \right)}^3}}}\)
Suppose a = 0.324, b = 0.221 and c = – 0.545
a + b – c = 0.324 + 0.221 – 0.545 = 0
Now, we can say, a3 + b3 – c3 = -3abc, similarly
⇒ (0.324)3 + (0.221)3 – (0.545)3 = –3 × 0.324 × 0.221 × 0.545
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {0.545} \right)\left( {0.081} \right)\left( {0.51} \right)\left( {5.2} \right)}}{{ - 3{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}0.324{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}0.221{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}0.545}}\)
After solving
⇒ (–1)

Question:

units of product D sold in 2016 = 1500

⇒ x = 1500 × (360/100) = 5400

Question: A is 25% more than B and B is 40% less than C. If C is 30% more than D, then by what percent is A less than D?
Solution:
Let the value of D be 100x
value of C = 100x × (130/100) = 130x
value of B = 130x × (60/100) = 78x
value of A = 78x × (125/100) = 97.5x
A is less than D by = 100x – 97.5x = 2.5x
A is less than D by (in %) = (2.5x/100x) × 100 = 2.5%

Question: The marked price of an article is Rs. 800 and it is sold at a discount of 19%. If there is a gain of 8%, then by what percent above the cost price was the article marked?
Solution:
MP of the article = 800
SP of the article = 800 × (81/100) = 648
CP of the article = 648 × (100/108) = 600
MP more than CP by = 800 – 600 = 200
MP more than CP by (in %) = (200/600) × 100 = 33.33%
Short trick:
Let MP is x% more than CP, then
x – 19 – 19x/100 = 8
⇒ 81x/100 = 19 + 8
⇒ x = 27 × (100/81) = 33.33%

Question:
The given bar graph shows the marks obtained by students in an examination.

The number of students who obtained less than 300 marks is what percent more than the number of students who obtained 350 or more marks?
Solution:
Number of students who obtained less than 300 marks = 30 + 45 + 60 = 135
Number of students who obtained 350 or more marks = 40 + 35 + 0 = 75
∴ Required percentage = [(135 – 75)/75] × 100 = 80%

Question:
Directions: The given bar graph shows the imports and exports (in Rs. crores) of steel by a country from 2013 to 2017.


Question:
What is the ratio of the total imports in 2015 and 2017 to the total exports in 2013 and 2016?
Solution:
Total imports in 2015 and 2017 = 450 + 550 = 1000
Total imports in 2013 and 2016 = 400 + 440 = 840
Required ratio = 1000 ∶ 840 = 25 ∶ 21
Short trick∶
Total imports in 2015 and 2017 = 450 + 550 = 1000
See in the option which number divided the 1000 perfectly only 25 divide the 1000, so option 3 is right.

Question:
Directions: The given bar graph shows the imports and exports (in Rs. crores) of steel by a country from 2013 to 2017.


Question:
The total imports of steel in 2014, 2016 and 2017 is what percent less than the total exports in 2013, 2015 and 2017 (correct to one decimal place)?
Solution:
Total imports of steel in 2014, 2016 and 2017 = 360 + 500 + 550 = 1410
Total exports of steel in 2013, 2015 and 2017 = 400 + 600 + 650 = 1650
∴ Required percentage = [(1650 – 1410)/1650] × 100 = 14.5

Question:
Directions: The given bar graph shows the imports and exports (in Rs. crores) of steel by a country from 2013 to 2017.


Question:
In how many years were the imports more than 80% of the average exports (per year) of the country during the given 5 years?
Solution:
Total exports over the years = 400 + 450 + 600 + 440 + 650 = 2540
Average exports over the years = 2540/5 = 508
80% of 508 = 508 × (80/100) = 406.4 crores
So, in 2015, 2016 and 2017 imports are more than 80% of the average exports per year.
∴ The correct option is 2nd i.e in 3 years
